channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Philadelphia Fed President Patrick Harker to retire next June
item.description: Philadelphia Federal Reserve President Patrick Harker will retire next June, the regional Fed bank announced Wednesday.

item.title: Bond market 'yield curve' returns to normal from inverted state that had raised recession fears
U.S. targets Russia over 2024 election influence operation
item.description: A group of Russians and entities in Russia were indicted in 2018 for interference in the 2016 election between Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton.

item.title: A track record that‚Äôll get your attention

Have you ever really calculated your win rate? On average, how often are you making winning trades? If you ask around, a lot of traders [‚Ä¶]

item.title: Super Micro‚Äôs stock just got downgraded for these four reasons
item.description: Barclays worries about three trends in the server maker‚Äôs business, plus inadequate investor transparency.

item.title: Job openings fell more than expected in July in another sign of labor market softening
item.description: The closely watched Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey showed that available positions fell to 7.67 million on the month.

item.title: Sweden's Volvo Cars scraps plan to sell only electric vehicles by 2030
item.description: The announcement means Volvo Cars follows in the footsteps of other industry players in scaling back its EV ambitions.

item.title: Lyft to cut some jobs as it restructures its bikes and scooters operation
item.description: Lyft disclosed Wednesday a restructuring of its bikes and scooters operation, which will lead to some job cuts and a charge of up to $46 million.

item.title: NFL's next big media rights payday is years off ‚Äî and subject to a shifting industry
item.description: The NFL and other leagues are waiting to see how the turmoil in the media industry shakes out before determining their future TV rights deals.

item.title: Microsoft dodges in-depth UK probe into hiring of staff from AI firm Inflection
item.description: Microsoft's hiring of employees from artificial intelligence firm Inflection was cleared by the U.K.'s competition regulator on Wednesday.

item.title: ‚ÄòWe‚Äôre happily married, mediocre gay men‚Äô: We‚Äôre 58, earn $160,000 and saved $2.2 million. We grew up poor. Our families treat us like ATMs. Are we OK?
item.description: ‚ÄúOur relatives are very poor, and our acquaintances are either single men getting by paycheck-to-paycheck, very successful professionals or trust-fund babies.‚Äù

item.title: Atlanta Fed President Bostic says officials can't wait for inflation to hit 2% before cutting
item.description: Bostic signaled that he is ready to start lowering rates even though inflation is still running above the Fed's target.

item.title: Job openings fell more than expected in July in another sign of labor market softening
item.description: The closely watched Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey showed that available positions fell to 7.67 million on the month.

item.title: Gearing up for another great-looking trading week

item.title: Moderna‚Äôs experimental mpox vaccine reduces severity of disease, early study finds
item.description: Amid mounting concerns about the spread of mpox, an experimental vaccine from Moderna may be poised to offer additional protection beyond currently available vaccines, research published Wednesday shows.

item.title: Nvidia shares slip after plunge that wiped out nearly $300 billion in market cap
item.description: Nvidia's huge rise in recent years has been directly related to its dominance in AI chips for data centers.

item.title: 'A declaration of bankruptcy': Unions lash out as Volkswagen weighs possible German plant closures
item.description: Management at German automotive giant Volkswagen is set to go toe-to-toe with workers on Wednesday as leaders are set to present details about possible cuts.
